    1249             : 
    1250             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    1251             : 
    1252             : static void expand_ptr_map(a_data_map  *map)
    1253             : /*
    1254             : Double the number of entries in the given map.  This requires rehashing.
    1255             : */
    1256             : {
    1257             :   a_data_map_entry  *new_table, *old_table = map->table;
    1258             :   a_map_index       mask = map->hash_mask;
    1259             :   a_map_index       k, n_slots = mask+1;
    1260             :   a_byte_count      old_size = n_slots*sizeof(a_data_map_entry);
    1261             :   a_byte_count      new_size = 2*old_size;
    1262             :   unsigned long     new_width = count_ones(mask)+1, old_width;
    1263             : 
    1264             :   if (new_width > MAX_WIDTH_REUSABLE_TABLE) {
    1265             :     new_table = (a_data_map_entry*)alloc_general(new_size);
    1266             :   } else if (free_map_tables[new_width] != NULL) {
    1267             :     new_table = free_map_tables[new_width];
    1268             :     free_map_tables[new_width] =
    1269             :                            (a_data_map_entry*)free_map_tables[new_width]->ptr;
    1270             :   } else {
    1271             :     new_table = (a_data_map_entry*)alloc_fe(new_size);
    1272             :   }  /* if */
    1273             :   memzero((char*)new_table, size_t_arg(new_size));
    1274             :   mask = mask*2+1;
    1275             :   for (k = 0; k<n_slots; ++k) {
    1276             :     a_byte  *ptr = old_table[k].ptr;
    1277             :     if (ptr != NULL) {
    1278             :       a_map_index  idx = hash_ptr(ptr) & mask;
    1279             :       while (new_table[idx].ptr != NULL) {
    1280             :         idx = (idx+1) & mask;
    1281             :       }  /* while */
    1282             :       new_table[idx] = old_table[k];
    1283             :     }  /* if */
    1284             :   }  /* for */
    1285             :   map->table = new_table;
    1286             :   map->hash_mask = mask;
    1287             :   old_width = new_width-1;
    1288             :   if (old_width > MAX_WIDTH_REUSABLE_TABLE) {
    1289             :     free_general(old_table, old_size);
    1290             :   } else {
    1291             :     old_table[0].ptr = (a_byte*)free_map_tables[old_width];
    1292             :     free_map_tables[old_width] = old_table;
    1293             :   }  /* if */
    1294             : }  /* expand_ptr_map */
    1295             : 
    1296             : 
    1297             : #ifdef TRACE_INTERPRETER_MAP
    1298             : 
    1299             : static a_byte
    1300             :                 *traced_iptr = NULL;
    1301             :                         /* Pointer that is checked for mapping activity.
    1302             :                            Intended to be set from within a debugger and
    1303             :                            watched by setting a breakpoint on function
    1304             :                            interpreter_map_intercept. */
    1305             : 
    1306             : static void interpreter_map_intercept(a_const_char  *msg)
    1307             : /*
    1308             : Function called when a map key equal to traced_iptr is entered into or removed
    1309             : from a map.
    1310             : */
    1311             : {
    1312             :   fprintf(f_debug, "\nMap activity for %p: %s\n", traced_iptr, msg);
    1313             : }  /* interpreter_map_intercept */
    1314             : 
    1315             : #define check_traced_iptr(ptr, msg)                                          \
    1316             :   if ((a_byte*)(ptr) == traced_iptr) interpreter_map_intercept(msg);
    1317             : 
    1318             : #else /* TRACE_INTERPRETER_MAP  */
    1319             : 
    1320             : #define check_traced_iptr(ptr, msg) /* Nothing */
    1321             : 
    1322             : #endif /* TRACE_INTERPRETER_MAP */
    1323             : 
    1324             : 
    1325             : /*
    1326             : Macro to add a (pointer, pointer) entry to a data map.  The key pointer (iptr)
    1327             : may not be in the map already.
    1328             : */
    1329             : #define map_ptr(map, iptr, dptr)                                             \
    1330             : {                                                                            \
    1331             :   uintptr_t    hash = hash_ptr(iptr);                                        \
    1332             :   a_map_index  mask = (map)->hash_mask;                                      \
    1333             :   a_map_index  idx = hash & mask;                                            \
    1334             :   a_data_map_entry  *table = (map)->table;                                   \
    1335             :   check_traced_iptr(iptr, "mapped");                                         \
    1336             :   if (table[idx].ptr == NULL) {                                              \
    1337             :     table[idx].ptr = (a_byte*)(iptr);                                        \
    1338             :     table[idx].data.ptr = (dptr);                                            \
    1339             :   } else {                                                                   \
    1340             :     a_data_map_entry  entry;                                                 \
    1341             :     entry.ptr = (a_byte*)(iptr);                                             \
    1342             :     entry.data.ptr = (dptr);                                                 \
    1343             :     map_colliding_ptr(map, entry, idx);                                      \
    1344             :   }  /* if */                                                                \
    1345             :   (map)->n_elements += 1;                                                    \
    1346             :   if ((map)->n_elements*2 > mask) {                                          \
    1347             :     expand_ptr_map(map);                                                     \
    1348             :   }  /* if */                                                                \
    1349             : }
    1350             : 
    1351             : 
    1352             : #define map_or_replace_ptr(map, iptr, dptr, old_dptr)                        \
    1353             : {                                                                            \
    1354             :   uintptr_t         hash = hash_ptr(iptr);                                   \
    1355             :   a_map_index       mask = (map)->hash_mask;                                 \
    1356             :   a_map_index       idx = hash & mask, idx0 = idx;                           \
    1357             :   a_data_map_entry  *table = (map)->table;                                   \
    1358             :   a_byte            *ptr = table[idx].ptr;                                   \
    1359             :   check_traced_iptr(iptr, "mapped or replaced");                             \
    1360             :   if (ptr == NULL) {                                                         \
    1361             :     table[idx].ptr = (a_byte*)(iptr);                                        \
    1362             :     table[idx].data.ptr = (dptr);                                            \
    1363             :     (map)->n_elements += 1;                                                  \
    1364             :     if ((map)->n_elements*2 > mask) {                                        \
    1365             :       expand_ptr_map(map);                                                   \
    1366             :     }  /* if */                                                              \
    1367             :     (old_dptr) = NULL;                                                       \
    1368             :   } else {                                                                   \
    1369             :     for (;;) {                                                               \
    1370             :       if (ptr == (a_byte*)(iptr)) {                                          \
    1371             :         (old_dptr) = table[idx].data.ptr;                                    \
    1372             :         table[idx].data.ptr = (dptr);                                        \
    1373             :         break;                                                               \
    1374             :       } else {                                                               \
    1375             :         idx = (idx+1) & mask;                                                \
    1376             :         ptr = table[idx].ptr;                                                \
    1377             :         if (ptr == NULL) {                                                   \
    1378             :           table[idx] = table[idx0];                                          \
    1379             :           table[idx].ptr = (a_byte*)(iptr);                                  \
    1380             :           table[idx].data.ptr = (dptr);                                      \
    1381             :           (map)->n_elements += 1;                                            \
    1382             :           if ((map)->n_elements*2 > mask) {                                  \
    1383             :             expand_ptr_map(map);                                             \
    1384             :           }  /* if */                                                        \
    1385             :           (old_dptr) = NULL;                                                 \
    1386             :           break;                                                             \
    1387             :         }  /* if */                                                          \
    1388             :       }  /* if */                                                            \
    1389             :     }  /* for */                                                             \
    1390             :   }  /* if */                                                                \
    1391             : }
    1392             : 
    1393             : 
    1394             : /*
    1395             : Macro to replace the pointer associated with iptr (which is known to be in
    1396             : the table).
    1397             : */
    1398             : #define replace_mapped_ptr(map, iptr, dptr)                                  \
    1399             : {                                                                            \
    1400             :   uintptr_t         hash = hash_ptr(iptr);                                   \
    1401             :   a_map_index       mask = (map)->hash_mask;                                 \
    1402             :   a_map_index       idx = hash & mask;                                       \
    1403             :   a_data_map_entry  *table = (map)->table;                                   \
    1404             :   a_byte            *ptr = table[idx].ptr;                                   \
    1405             :   check_traced_iptr(iptr, "replaced");                                       \
    1406             :   for (;;) {                                                                 \
    1407             :     if (ptr == (a_byte*)(iptr)) {                                            \
    1408             :       table[idx].data.ptr = (dptr);                                          \
    1409             :       break;                                                                 \
    1410             :     } else {                                                                 \
    1411             :       idx = (idx+1) & mask;                                                  \
    1412             :       ptr = table[idx].ptr;                                                  \
    1413             :     }  /* if */                                                              \
    1414             :   }  /* for */                                                               \
    1415             : }
    1416             : 
    1417             : 
    1418             : /*
    1419             : Macro to add a (pointer, byte-count) entry to a data map.
    1420             : */
    1421             : #define map_byte_count(map, iptr, bcount)                                    \
    1422             : {                                                                            \
    1423             :   uintptr_t    hash = hash_ptr(iptr);                                        \
    1424             :   a_map_index  mask = (map)->hash_mask;                                      \
    1425             :   a_map_index  idx = hash & mask;                                            \
    1426             :   a_data_map_entry  *table = (map)->table;                                   \
    1427             :   a_byte            *cached_ptr = table[idx].ptr;                            \
    1428             :   check_traced_iptr(iptr, "mapped (bytecount)");                             \
    1429             :   if (cached_ptr == NULL) {                                                  \
    1430             :     table[idx].ptr = (a_byte*)(iptr);                                        \
    1431             :     table[idx].data.byte_count = (bcount);                                   \
    1432             :   } else {                                                                   \
    1433             :     a_data_map_entry  entry;                                                 \
    1434             :     entry.ptr = (a_byte*)(iptr);                                             \
    1435             :     entry.data.byte_count = (bcount);                                        \
    1436             :     map_colliding_ptr(map, entry, idx);                                      \
    1437             :   }  /* if */                                                                \
    1438             :   (map)->n_elements += 1;                                                    \
    1439             :   if ((map)->n_elements*2 > mask) {                                          \
    1440             :     expand_ptr_map(map);                                                     \
    1441             :   }  /* if */                                                                \
    1442             : }
    1443             : 
    1444          89 : static void map_colliding_ptr(a_data_map        *map,
    1445             :                               a_data_map_entry  new_entry,
    1446             :                               a_map_index       idx)
    1447             : /*
    1448             : The given map entry collides with an existing entry in the given map.  Move
    1449             : the existing entry to the next free entry, and record new_entry at the given
    1450             : location.
    1451             : */
    1452             : {
    1453          89 :   a_map_index       mask = map->hash_mask;
    1454          89 :   a_data_map_entry  *table = map->table;
    1455          89 :   a_data_map_entry  saved_entry;
    1456             : 
    1457             : #if EXPENSIVE_CHECKING
    1458             :   { a_byte  *dptr;
    1459             :     get_mapped_ptr(map, new_entry.ptr, dptr)
    1460             :     if (dptr != NULL) {
    1461             :       unexpected_condition_str("duplicate map key in interpreter");
    1462             :     }  /* if */
    1463             :   }
    1464             : #endif /* EXPENSIVE_CHECKING */
    1465             :   /* Place the new mapping at idx, and move the existing mapping to the
    1466             :      next available spot. */
    1467          89 :   saved_entry = table[idx];
    1468          89 :   table[idx] = new_entry;
    1469         117 :   for (;;) {
    1470         117 :     idx = (idx+1) & mask;
    1471         117 :     if (table[idx].ptr == NULL) {
    1472          89 :       table[idx] = saved_entry;
    1473          89 :       break;
    1474             :     }  /* if */
    1475             :   }  /* for */
    1476             : }  /* map_colliding_ptr */
    1477             : 
    1478             : 
    1479             : #define unmap_ptr(map, iptr)                                                 \
    1480             : {                                                                            \
    1481             :   uintptr_t         hash = hash_ptr(iptr);                                   \
    1482             :   a_map_index       mask = (map)->hash_mask;                                 \
    1483             :   a_map_index       idx = hash & mask;                                       \
    1484             :   a_data_map_entry  *table = (map)->table;                                   \
    1485             :   check_traced_iptr(iptr, "UNmapped");                                       \
    1486             :   /* Find the item to delete (we're assuming it exists). */                  \
    1487             :   while (table[idx].ptr != (a_byte*)iptr) {                                  \
    1488             :     idx = (idx+1) & mask;                                                    \
    1489             :   }  /* while */                                                             \
    1490             :   table[idx].ptr = NULL;                                                     \
    1491             :   /* If the next slot is empty, we're done.  Otherwise, we may have to */    \
    1492             :   /* move another element into the emptied slot. */                          \
    1493             :   if (table[(idx+1) & mask].ptr != NULL) {                                   \
    1494             :     check_deleted_data_map_slot(map, idx);                                   \
    1495             :   }  /* if */                                                                \
    1496             :   (map)->n_elements -= 1;                                                    \
    1497             : }
    1498             : 
    1499             : 
    1500             : static void check_deleted_data_map_slot(a_data_map   *map,
    1501             :                                         a_map_index  idx0)
    1502             : /*
    1503             : Slot idx has been cleared in the given map (i.e., map->table[idx].ptr has been
    1504             : set to NULL).  The next slot is not empty.  There may therefore exist entries
    1505             : that are associated with that slot (i.e., have the same hash index).  This
    1506             : function makes sure that such entries can be found, by moving up entries as
    1507             : needed.
    1508             : 
    1509             : This corresponds to Algorithm R in section 6.4 of volume 3 of Donald E. Knuth's
    1510             : "The Art of Computer Programming" (Sorting and Searching -- Second Edition),
    1511             : with the assumption that step R1 has already been performed (idx0 is "j") and
    1512             : we know that the subsequent slot is not empty.
    1513             : */
    1514             : {
    1515             :   a_data_map_entry  *table = map->table;
    1516             :   a_map_index       mask = map->hash_mask;
    1517             :   a_map_index       idx, ridx;
    1518             :   a_byte            *rptr;
    1519             :   
    1520             :   idx = (idx0+1) & mask;
    1521             :   rptr = table[idx].ptr;
    1522             :   for (;;) {
    1523             :     for (;;) {
    1524             :       ridx = hash_ptr(rptr) & mask;
    1525             :       /* See if we can move the entry at idx to idx0.  ridx is its "ideal"
    1526             :          slot: the place from where probing will start.  So we cannot move it
    1527             :          ahead of there.  I.e., if idx0 lies outside [ridx, idx-1] (considering
    1528             :          "wrap-around"), do not move the entry and try the next entry
    1529             :          instead. */
    1530             :       if ((ridx <= idx0 && idx0 < idx) ||
    1531             :           (idx0 >= ridx && idx < ridx) ||
    1532             :           (idx0 < idx && idx < ridx)) {
    1533             :         /* idx0 is in [ridx, idx-1]: Move the entry. */
    1534             :         break;
    1535             :       } else {
    1536             :         idx = (idx+1) & mask;
    1537             :         rptr = table[idx].ptr;
    1538             :         if (rptr == NULL) goto done;
    1539             :       }  /* if */
    1540             :     }  /* for */
    1541             :     table[idx0] = table[idx];
    1542             :     table[idx].ptr = NULL;
    1543             :     idx0 = idx;
    1544             :     idx = (idx0+1) & mask;
    1545             :     rptr = table[idx].ptr;
    1546             :     if (rptr == NULL) goto done;
    1547             :   }  /* for */
    1548             : done:;
    1549             : }  /* check_deleted_data_map_slot */
    1550             : 
    1551             : 
    1552             : /*
    1553             : Convenience macro to map an IL pointer (iptr) to a pointer (sptr) to stack
    1554             : storage associated.  ips is the interpreter state managing the stack storage.
    1555             : 
    1556             : If an existing mapping exists for iptr, the new mapping supersedes it (until
    1557             : it is unmapped).
    1558             : */
    1559             : #define map_stack_bytes(ips, iptr, sptr)                                     \
    1560             :   map_ptr(&(ips)->map, iptr, sptr)
    1561             : 
    1562             : 
    1563             : /*
    1564             : Convenience macro to unmap the pointer to stack storage associated with an
    1565             : IL pointer (iptr).  ips is the interpreter state managing the stack storage.
    1566             : 
    1567             : If an older mapping exists for iptr, that mapping becomes active again.
    1568             : */
    1569             : #define unmap_stack_bytes(ips, iptr)                                         \
    1570             :   unmap_ptr(&(ips)->map, iptr)
    1571             : 
    1572             : 
    1573             : /*
    1574             : Useful constants.
    1575             : */
    1576             : static an_integer_value
    1577             :                 zero_int;
    1578             : static an_integer_value
    1579             :                 one_int;
    1580             : static an_internal_float_value
    1581             :                 zero_flt[(int)fk_last];
    1582             : static an_internal_float_value
    1583             :                 one_flt[(int)fk_last];
    1584             : static a_boolean
    1585             :                 useful_constants_initialized;
    1586             :                         /* Flag indicating whether these constants have
    1587             :                            been initialized yet. */
    1588             : 
    1589             : 
    1590             : /*
    1591             : Structure describing a variant path in a subobject.
    1592             : 
    1593             : An address of a subobject of a union can be formed even if that subobject is
    1594             : not currently active in the union.  Only at the point of dereference must the
    1595             : requirement that the subobject is active be enforced.  To achieve this, address
    1596             : manipulations in unions maintain a "variant path" that can be checked at the
    1597             : point of dereference.  The first entry on the path describes the base address
    1598             : of an array: The entry can be ignored if the address does not have the
    1599             : CA_ARRAY_ELEMENT flag set.  Every element after that represents a selected
    1600             : variant (from outer selection to inner selection).  For example:
    1601             : 
    1602             :   struct S {
    1603             :     int i;
    1604             :     union U {
    1605             :       struct X {
    1606             :         union V {
    1607             :           int i;
    1608             :           char y[3];
    1609             :         } v;
    1610             :       } x;
    1611             :     } u[4];
    1612             :   } s;
    1613             : 
    1614             : The a_constexpr_address entry representing &s.u[2].x.v.y[1] will have both the
    1615             : CA_VARIANT_PATH and CA_ARRAY_ELEMENT flags set (the latter flag is for the y[1]
    1616             : part; not the u[2] part since the address is not of the s.u[2] element
    1617             : specifically).  The address entry will point to a list of three variant path
    1618             : entries.  The first entry will record the base address of s.u[2].x.v.y.  The
    1619             : second will point to the address of the s.u[2] subobject and to the IL entry
    1620             : for its x field.  The third entry will point to the address of the s.u[2].x.v
    1621             : subobject and to the IL entry for its y field.  Dereferencing the address will
    1622             : check that the two unions' active fields correspond to those recorded in the
    1623             : path (if they don't, interpretation fails).
    1624             : */
    1625             : typedef struct a_variant_path_entry *a_variant_path_entry_ptr;
    1626             : typedef struct a_variant_path_entry {
    1627             :   a_variant_path_entry_ptr
    1628             :                 next;
    1629             :                         /* For entries on a variant path, the next entry on
    1630             :                            that path (or NULL if there is none).  Otherwise,
    1631             :                            the entry is on the free entries list and this field
    1632             :                            points to the next free entry (or NULL if there is
    1633             :                            none). */
    1634             :   a_variant_path_entry_ptr
    1635             :                 next_allocated;
    1636             :                         /* The next entry on the list of all allocated variant
    1637             :                            path entries (NULL if it's the last entry). */
    1638             :   a_field_ptr   field;
    1639             :                         /* The field selected for this variant path, or NULL
    1640             :                            if this entry represents the base address of an
    1641             :                            indexed array. */
    1642             :   a_byte        *base_address;
    1643             :                         /* The address of the variant (i.e., union) subobject
    1644             :                            in interpreter storage, or, if field is NULL, the
    1645             :                            base address of the indexed array. */
    1646             : } a_variant_path_entry;
    1647             : 
    1648             : static a_variant_path_entry_ptr
    1649             :                 variant_path_entries;
    1650             :                         /* A list of all allocated variant path entries,
    1651             :                            linked through the next_allocated pointers. */
    1652             : 
    1653             : static unsigned long
    1654             :                 n_variant_path_entries;
    1655             :                         /* The number of entries on the variant_path_entries
    1656             :                            list. */
    1657             : 
    1658             : static a_variant_path_entry_ptr
    1659             :                 free_variant_path_entries;
    1660             :                         /* A list of variant path entries available for reuse,
    1661             :                            linked through the next pointers. */
    1662             : 
    1663             : static unsigned long
    1664             :                 n_free_variant_path_entries;
    1665             :                         /* The number of entries on the
    1666             :                            free_variant_path_entries list. */
    1667             : 
    1668           0 : static a_variant_path_entry_ptr alloc_variant_path_entry(void)
    1669             : /*
    1670             : Return a new variant path entry.
    1671             : */
    1672             : {
    1673           0 :   a_variant_path_entry_ptr vpep;
    1674             : 
    1675           0 :   if (free_variant_path_entries != NULL) {
    1676           0 :     vpep = free_variant_path_entries;
    1677           0 :     free_variant_path_entries = free_variant_path_entries->next;
    1678           0 :     n_free_variant_path_entries -= 1;
    1679             :   } else {
    1680           0 :     vpep = alloc_fe_of_type(a_variant_path_entry);
    1681           0 :     vpep->next_allocated = variant_path_entries;
    1682           0 :     variant_path_entries = vpep;
    1683           0 :     n_variant_path_entries += 1;
    1684             :   }  /* if */
    1685           0 :   return vpep;
    1686             : }  /* alloc_variant_path_entry */
    1687             : 
    1688             : 
    1689           0 : static void reclaim_variant_path_entries(void)
    1690             : /*
    1691             : The caller has determined that not all variant path entries were reclaimed at
    1692             : the end of interpretation.  Move all allocated entries back onto the free list.
    1693             : */
    1694             : {
    1695           0 :   a_variant_path_entry_ptr  vpep = variant_path_entries;
    1696             : 
    1697           0 :   check_assertion(n_free_variant_path_entries < n_variant_path_entries);
    1698           0 :   while (vpep->next_allocated != NULL) {
    1699           0 :     vpep->next = vpep->next_allocated;
    1700           0 :     vpep = vpep->next_allocated;
    1701             :   }  /* while */
    1702           0 :   vpep->next = NULL;
    1703           0 :   free_variant_path_entries = variant_path_entries;
    1704           0 :   n_free_variant_path_entries = n_variant_path_entries;
    1705           0 : }  /* reclaim_variant_path_entries */
    1706             : 
    1707             : 
    1708             : /*
    1709             : A set of flags to describe special interpreter address attributes.
    1710             : */
    1711             : #define CA_RUNTIME_DATA_ADDRESS ((unsigned int)0x1)
    1712             :                 /* This flag indicates that the address is that of a run-time
    1713             :                    entity (not a value known to the interpreter). */
    1714             : #define CA_CANNOT_DEREFERENCE ((unsigned int)0x2)
    1715             :                 /* This flag indicates that the address cannot be dereferenced.
    1716             :                    It is set in particular for pointers "one position past" the
    1717             :                    end of an array. */
    1718             : #define CA_VARIANT_PATH ((unsigned int)0x4)
    1719             :                 /* This flag indicates that the formation of the address
    1720             :                    included the selection of at least one union field.  Such
    1721             :                    selections must be checked for validity when the address is
    1722             :                    dereferenced. */
    1723             : #define CA_ARRAY_ELEMENT ((unsigned int)0x8)
    1724             :                 /* This flag indicates that the address is that of an array
    1725             :                    element.  Such an address is subject to pointer
    1726             :                    arithmetic (which requires bounds checking). */
    1727             : #define CA_BIT_FIELD ((unsigned int)0x10)
    1728             :                 /* This flag indicates that the address is that of a bit field.
    1729             :                    (Pointers and references to bit fields are invalid.  This is
    1730             :                    therefore always for a bit field lvalue.)  Whether the bit
    1731             :                    field is signed is encoded in the "length" field. */
    1732             : #define CA_FUNCTION ((unsigned int)0x20)
    1733             :                 /* This flag indicates that the address is that of a
    1734             :                    function. */
    1735             : #define CA_CONST_STORAGE ((unsigned int)0x40)
    1736             :                 /* This flag indicates that the address is that of const
    1737             :                    storage. */
    1738             : #define CA_LIFETIME_EXTENDED ((unsigned int)0x80)
    1739             :                 /* This flag indicates that the address is that of a lifetime-
    1740             :                    extended temporary. */
    1741             : 
    1742             : /*
    1743             : Structure describing the representation of an address in the interpreter.
    1744             : (Addresses in the interpreter are used to represent pointers, references, and
    1745             : glvalues.)
    1746             : */
    1747             : typedef struct a_constexpr_address {
    1748             :   a_byte
    1749             :                 *address;
    1750             :                         /* The address in interpreter storage of the thing
    1751             :                            pointed to, or NULL if is_runtime_data_address or
    1752             :                            is_function_address are TRUE. */
    1753             :   unsigned int  flags:8;
    1754             :                         /* Flags describing properties of this address.
    1755             :                            See the CA_... macros above. */
    1756             :   unsigned int
    1757             :                 length: 24;
    1758             :                         /* If the CA_ARRAY_ELEMENT flag is set or for an array
    1759             :                            lvalue, the number of elements in the array.  If the
    1760             :                            CA_BIT_FIELD flag is set, twice the number of bits
    1761             :                            in the bit field designated by this lvalue, plus one
    1762             :                            if the bit field is signed.  If the flag
    1763             :                            CA_RUNTIME_DATA_ADDRESS is set, a value of 1
    1764             :                            indicates that a field selection was applied to that
    1765             :                            address and so it should be assumed to point to an
    1766             :                            object even if it is a null address (used to
    1767             :                            support classic implementations of "offsetof").
    1768             :                            Otherwise, zero. */
    1769             : #define MAX_ARRAY_LENGTH ((1<<24) - 1)
    1770             :   an_alloc_seq_number
    1771             :                 alloc_seq_number;
    1772             :                         /* The allocation sequence number of the storage
    1773             :                            pointed to. */
    1774             :   union {
    1775             :     /* When (flags & CA_ARRAY_ELEMENT) != 0 and
    1776             :             (flags & CA_VARIANT_PATH) == 0: */
    1777             :     a_byte
    1778             :                 *base_address;
    1779             :                         /* For an array element, the address of element #0. */
    1780             :     /* When (flags & CA_FUNCTION) != 0: */
    1781             :     a_routine_ptr
    1782             :                 routine;
    1783             :                         /* For addresses of functions. */
    1784             :     /* When (flags & CA_RUNTIME_DATA_ADDRESS) != 0: */
    1785             :     a_constant_ptr
    1786             :                 addr_con;
    1787             :                         /* For constant addresses of run-time objects. */
    1788             :     /* When (flags & CA_VARIANT_PATH) != 0: */
    1789             :     a_variant_path_entry_ptr
    1790             :                 variant_path;
    1791             :                         /* For addresses into variant subobjects, the recorded
    1792             :                            path of the subobject.  The path is checked against
    1793             :                            active fields at the point of dereference. */
    1794             :   } variant;
    1795             :   a_byte
    1796             :                 *complete_object;
    1797             :                         /* Pointer to the complete object into which this
    1798             :                            address is pointing.  This is needed to validate
    1799             :                            pointer comparisons (p < q, etc.). */
    1800             : } a_constexpr_address;
    1801             : 
    1802             : 
    1803             : #define is_runtime_data_address(cap)                                         \
    1804             :   ((((a_constexpr_address*)(cap))->flags & CA_RUNTIME_DATA_ADDRESS) != 0)
    1805             : 
    1806             : #define cannot_dereference(cap)                                              \
    1807             :   ((((a_constexpr_address*)(cap))->flags & CA_CANNOT_DEREFERENCE) != 0)
    1808             : 
    1809             : #define is_variant_path(cap)                                                 \
    1810             :   ((((a_constexpr_address*)(cap))->flags & CA_VARIANT_PATH) != 0)
    1811             : 
    1812             : #define is_array_element(cap)                                                \
    1813             :   ((((a_constexpr_address*)(cap))->flags & CA_ARRAY_ELEMENT) != 0)
    1814             : 
    1815             : #define is_bit_field_lvalue(cap)                                             \
    1816             :   ((((a_constexpr_address*)(cap))->flags & CA_BIT_FIELD) != 0)
    1817             : 
    1818             : #define is_function_address(cap)                                             \
    1819             :   ((((a_constexpr_address*)(cap))->flags & CA_FUNCTION) != 0)
    1820             : 
    1821             : #define is_const_storage(cap)                                                \
    1822             :   ((((a_constexpr_address*)(cap))->flags & CA_CONST_STORAGE) != 0)
    1823             : 
    1824             : 
    1825             : #define get_base_address(cap)                                                \
    1826             :   (is_variant_path(cap) ? (cap)->variant.variant_path->base_address          \
    1827             :                         : (cap)->variant.base_address)
    1828             : 
    1829             : static void get_runtime_array_pos(a_constexpr_address  *cap,
    1830             :                                   a_byte_count         elem_size,
    1831             :                                   a_byte_count         *a_len,
    1832             :                                   a_byte_count         *p_pos)
    1833             : /*
    1834             : cap represents a run-time address constant or null pointer and elem_size the
    1835             : size of the element type being addressed.  For null pointers, set *a_len and
    1836             : *p_pos to zero.  Otherwise, return in *a_len the number of objects pointed to
    1837             : if known (the length of an array or one for a non-array object); if unknown,
    1838             : return MAX_ARRAY_LENGTH.  Return in *p_pos the "array" position being
    1839             : addressed (with non-array objects treated as arrays of one element).
    1840             : */
    1841             : {
    1842             :   a_constant_ptr  con_addr = cap->variant.addr_con;
    1843             :   a_byte_count    length, pos;
    1844             :   a_type_ptr      tp;
    1845             :   a_constant_ptr  cp;
    1846             : 
    1847             :   if (!constant_is(con_addr, ck_address)) {
    1848             :     check_assertion(constant_is(con_addr, ck_integer));
    1849             :     if (cmp_integer_values(&con_addr->variant.integer_value,
    1850             :                            /*op_1_signed=*/FALSE,
    1851             :                            (an_integer_value *)&zero_int,
    1852             :                            /*op_2_signed=*/FALSE) == 0) {
    1853             :       /* A null pointer value. */
    1854             :       length = 0;
    1855             :       pos = 0;
    1856             :     } else {
    1857             :       /* A run-time address formed by casting an arbitrary non-zero integer
    1858             :          to a pointer type (e.g., "(char*)0x1234").  Any length and position
    1859             :          is a-priori possible. */
    1860             :       length = MAX_ARRAY_LENGTH;
    1861             :       pos = 0;
    1862             :     }  /* if */
    1863             :   } else if (elem_size == 0) {
    1864             :     /* In some modes (e.g., GNU C), types can have size zero.  Any length and
    1865             :        position is a-priori possible. */
    1866             :     length = MAX_ARRAY_LENGTH;
    1867             :     pos = 0;
    1868             :   } else {
    1869             :     switch(con_addr->variant.address.kind) {
    1870             :       case abk_variable:
    1871             :         tp = skip_typerefs(con_addr->variant.address.variant.variable->type);
    1872             :         /* Ignore incomplete arrays, flexible arrays. */
    1873             :         if (!tp->incomplete &&
    1874             :             !(is_immediate_class_type(tp) &&
    1875             :               tp->variant.class_struct_union.contains_flexible_array_member)) {
    1876             :           length = (a_byte_count)tp->size/elem_size;
    1877             :         } else {
    1878             :           length = MAX_ARRAY_LENGTH;
    1879             :         }  /* if */
    1880             :         break;
    1881             :       case abk_constant:
    1882             :       case abk_temporary:
    1883             :         cp = con_addr->variant.address.variant.constant;
    1884             :         if (constant_is(cp, ck_string)) {
    1885             :           length = (a_byte_count)cp->variant.string.length/elem_size;
    1886             :         } else {
    1887             :           length = (a_byte_count)skip_typerefs(cp->type)->size/elem_size;
    1888             :         }  /* if */
    1889             :         break;
    1890             :       case abk_uuidof:
    1891             :         tp = type_pointed_to(con_addr->type);
    1892             :         length = (a_byte_count)skip_typerefs(tp)->size/elem_size;
    1893             :         break;
    1894             :       case abk_typeid:
    1895             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    1896             :       case abk_cli_typeid:
    1897             :       case abk_cli_array:
    1898             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    1899             :         /* The object is std::type_info or a class derived from it, or a
    1900             :            handle to a C++/CLI System::String or System::Array.  Therefore, we
    1901             :            don't really know the actual size. */
    1902             :         length = MAX_ARRAY_LENGTH;
    1903             :         break;
    1904             :       case abk_routine:
    1905             :       case abk_label:
    1906             :       default:
    1907             :         length = 0;
    1908             :         unexpected_condition();
    1909             :     }  /* switch */
    1910             :     pos = (a_byte_count)con_addr->variant.address.offset / elem_size;
    1911             :   }  /* if */
    1912             :   *a_len = length;
    1913             :   *p_pos = pos;
    1914             : }  /* get_runtime_array_pos */
    1915             : 
    1916             : 
    1917             : /*
    1918             : Given a data address cap pointing to an object of type elem_type, treat it as
    1919             : the address of an element of an array (an array of length one if it's not
    1920             : actually an array element).  Produce in *a_len, *pos, and *e_size,
    1921             : respectively, the type of the element, the number of elements in the array,
    1922             : the element position in the array, and the size of an element in the array.
    1923             : This macro applies to both interpreter addresses and run-time addresses, but
    1924             : in the case of run-time addresses the array length is set to MAX_ARRAY_LENGTH
    1925             : if the actual length cannot be determined.  Set *p_result to FALSE if an error
    1926             : occurs.
    1927             : */
    1928             : #define get_array_pos(ips, cap, elem_type, a_len, pos, e_size, p_result)     \
    1929             : {                                                                            \
    1930             :   if (is_runtime_data_address(cap)) {                                        \

    2299             : failure (*ips is updated accordingly).

    2369             : *p_result is set to FALSE.

    2371             : {
    2372       23137 :   a_byte_count  result;
    2373             :

    2557             : 
    2558        1192 : static a_field_ptr next_alloc_field(a_field_ptr  field)
    2559             : /*
    2560             : Given a pointer to a field (or NULL), return a pointer to the first field at
    2561             : or after the given field that is allocated as such in the interpreter.
    2562             : Unnamed bit fields, for example, are not allocated, and are skipped by
    2563             : initialization processing.  If there is no next such field, return NULL.  This
    2564             : is similar to next_alloc_field except it also skips fields generated
    2565             : by lowering.
    2566             : */
    2567             : {
    2568        1192 :   for (; field != NULL; field = field->next) {
    2569             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    2570             :     /* Skip any property or event fields. */
    2571             :     if (field->property_or_event_descr != NULL) continue;
    2572             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    2573             :     /* Skip fields generated by lowering. */
    2574         453 :     if (symbol_for(field) == NULL && !field->is_captured_this) continue;
    2575             :     /* Unnamed bit fields are not initializable. */
    2576         453 :     if (has_name(field) || !field->is_bit_field) break;
    2577             :     /* Anonymous unions are also initializable in C++.  An extension allows
    2578             :        anonymous parent objects in C too. */
    2579           0 :     if (field->is_anonymous_parent_object) break;
    2580             :   }  /* for */
    2581        1192 :   return field;
    2582             : }  /* next_alloc_field */

    2585         330 : static a_byte_count lay_out_class_type(an_interpreter_state  *ips,
    2586             :                                        a_type_ptr            tp,
    2587             :                                        a_boolean             *p_result)
    2588             : /*
    2589             : Compute and return the size of the given non-union class type.  Also record
    2590             : offsets in any associated fields as well as any direct or virtual base classes.
    2591             : If needed, this will recursively lay out types this class type is composed of.
    2592             : ips is used to record an interpretation failure if the size exceeds the
    2593             : interpreter's limits; in that case, *p_result is set to FALSE.
    2594             : */

    2596         330 :   a_byte_count      total_size = 0;
    2597         330 :   a_field_ptr       fp;

    2600         330 :                       tp->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_base_classes;
    2601             :

    2684           8 : static a_byte_count lay_out_union_type(an_interpreter_state  *ips,
    2685             :                                        a_type_ptr            tp,
    2686             :                                        a_boolean             *p_result)
    2687             : /*

    2726           0 : static void find_subobject_for_interpreter_address(
    2727             :                                         an_interpreter_state  *ips,
    2728             :                                         a_constexpr_address   *cap,
    2729             :                                         a_byte                *parent_address,
    2730             :                                         a_type_ptr            parent_type,
    2731             :                                         a_field_ptr           *p_field,
    2732             :                                         a_base_class_ptr      *p_bcp)
    2733             : /*
    2734             : cap represents an interpreter address pointing into interpreter storage for an
    2735             : object X of type parent_type stored at parent_address (not necessarily a
    2736             : complete object).  Return the direct subobject of X that cap points to (or
    2737             : "into") via *p_field and *p_bcp (for field subobjects *p_bcp is set to NULL;
    2738             : for base class subobjects *p_field is set to NULL).  If cap points "one past
    2739             : the end" of a field subobject, that field is returned.
    2740             : */
    2741             : {
    2742           0 :   if (parent_type->kind != (a_type_kind)tk_union) {
    2743             :     /* Search among base classes and fields for the one that covers the offset
    2744             :        of the given address.  We search through direct subobjects in allocation
    2745             :        order. */
    2746           0 :     a_field_ptr       fp = parent_type->variant.class_struct_union.field_list;
    2747           0 :     a_field_ptr       last_fp = next_alloc_field(fp);
    2748           0 :     a_base_class_ptr  bcp, last_bcp;
    2749           0 :     a_boolean         okay = TRUE, check_virtual_bases = FALSE;
    2750           0 :     a_byte_count      offset = (a_byte_count)(cap->address - parent_address),

    2752           0 :     sub_offset = sizeof(a_type_ptr);
    2753           0 :     do_host_alignment(sub_offset);
    2754             :     /* First search through the fields. */
    2755           0 :     if (last_fp == NULL) {
    2756             :       /* There are no allocated fields: Look among the base classes. */
    2757           0 :       goto search_base_subobjects;
    2758             :     }  /* if */
    2759           0 :     for (fp = next_alloc_field(last_fp->next);
    2760           0 :          fp != NULL;

    2763           0 :       if (offset < sub_offset ||
    2764           0 :           (offset == sub_offset && cannot_dereference(cap))) {
    2765           0 :         *p_field = last_fp;
    2766           0 :         *p_bcp = NULL;
    2767           0 :         goto done;
    2768             :       }  /* if */
    2769             :     }  /* for */
    2770           0 :     type_size = value_bytes_for_type(ips, last_fp->type, &okay);

    2772           0 :         (offset-sub_offset == type_size && cannot_dereference(cap))) {
    2773           0 :       check_assertion(okay);

    2776           0 :       goto done;

    2778           0 : search_base_subobjects:

    2792           0 :             *p_bcp = last_bcp;

    2842             : 
    2843             : 
    2844             : #define record_subobject_derivation(subobj_ptr, bcp)                         \
    2845             :   *(void**)(subobj_ptr) = (void*)(bcp);
    2846             : 
    2847             : /*
    2848             : Class type subobjects record their relationship to the next-more-derived
    2849             : subobject with a base class entry pointer, or NULL for a most-derived object.
    2850             : The following macro records that NULL (for proper base subobjects, the base
    2851             : class entry pointer is recorded when the base subobject is initialized).  For
    2852             : unions, the recorded pointer represents the active field rather than a base
    2853             : class entry.  (This must therefore be invoked before placing a result in the
    2854             : indicated storage, because that result could set the active field.)
    2855             : */
    2856             : #define mark_complete_class_object_if_needed(utp, storage_ptr)               \
    2857             :   if (is_immediate_class_type(utp)) {                                        \
    2858             :     record_subobject_derivation(storage_ptr, NULL);                          \
    2859             :   }  /* if */                                                                \

    2861             : #if DEBUG && TRACK_INTERPRETER_ALLOCATIONS

    2863             : static a_data_map
    2864             :                 object_alloc_map;
    2865             :                         /* Map tracking allocations of complete objects. */
    2866             : 
    2867             : static a_byte_count
    2868             :                 object_alloc_to_intercept;
    2869             :                         /* The allocation number to intercept (0 if none). */
    2870             : 
    2871             : 
    2872             : static void object_alloc_intercept(void)
    2873             : /*
    2874             : Called if the object indicated by object_alloc_to_intercept is allocated.
    2875             : Place a breakpoint on this function to find out when a certain complete object
    2876             : is allocated.
    2877             : */
    2878             : {
    2879             :   fprintf(f_debug, "Allocated interpreter object #%u\n",
    2880             :           object_alloc_to_intercept);
    2881             : }  /* object_alloc_intercept */
    2882             : 
    2883             : 
    2884             : static void track_complete_object_alloc(a_byte  *ptr)
    2885             : /*
    2886             : Record the given pointer to a just-allocated complete object in a map along
    2887             : with a unique integer value.  That unique value can be retrieved by calling
    2888             : db_object_alloc_num and can be assigned to object_alloc_to_intercept when the
    2889             : front end starts up to find where the object is originally allocated.
    2890             : */
    2891             : {
    2892             :   static a_boolean     map_ready = FALSE;
    2893             :   static a_byte_count  alloc_num = 0, prev_num;
    2894             : 
    2895             :   if (!map_ready) {
    2896             :     init_data_map(&object_alloc_map, /*mask_width=*/5U);
    2897             :     map_ready = TRUE;
    2898             :   }  /* if */
    2899             :   alloc_num += 1;
    2900             :   if (alloc_num == object_alloc_to_intercept) {
    2901             :     object_alloc_intercept();
    2902             :   }  /* if */
    2903             :   get_mapped_byte_count(&object_alloc_map, ptr, prev_num);
    2904             :   if (prev_num != 0) {
    2905             :     unmap_ptr(&object_alloc_map, ptr);
    2906             :   }  /* if */
    2907             :   map_byte_count(&object_alloc_map, ptr, alloc_num);
    2908             : }  /* track_complete_object_alloc */

    2910             : 
    2911             : unsigned long db_object_alloc_num(a_byte  *ptr)

    2926             : 
    2927             : /*
    2928             : Record the type of a complete object in its prefix.
    2929             : */
    2930             : #define record_complete_object_type(utp, data_ptr)                           \
    2931             :   track_complete_object_alloc(data_ptr);                                     \
    2932             :   (*(a_type_ptr*)(data_ptr-sizeof(a_type_ptr)) = (utp))
    2933             : 
    2934             : /*
    2935             : Retrieve the type of a complete object in its prefix.
    2936             : */
    2937             : #define complete_object_type(data_ptr)                                       \
    2938             :   (*(a_type_ptr*)(data_ptr-sizeof(a_type_ptr)))
    2939             : 
    2940             : /*
    2941             : Given a type utp and the size n_bytes required to represent its value, compute
    2942             : the number of bytes needed as a bookkeeping prefix for a complete object of
    2943             : that type.
    2944             : */
    2945             : #define compute_prefix_size_for_type(utp, n_bytes, prefix_size)              \
    2946             : {                                                                            \
    2947             :   a_byte_count  bitmap_size;                                                 \
    2948             :   if (is_immediate_class_type(utp) ||                                        \
    2949             :       utp->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_array) {                                  \
    2950             :     bitmap_size = (n_bytes+CHAR_BIT-1)/CHAR_BIT;                             \
    2951             :   } else {                                                                   \
    2952             :     bitmap_size = 0;                                                         \
    2953             :   }  /* if */                                                                \
    2954             :   prefix_size = 1+sizeof(a_type_ptr)+bitmap_size;                            \
    2955             :   do_host_alignment(prefix_size);                                            \
    2956             : }
    2957             : 
    2958             : 
    2959             : #if DEBUG
    2960             : #define debug_scramble(ptr, n_bytes) (void)memset(ptr, 0xdb, n_bytes)
    2961             : #else /* !DEBUG */
    2962             : #define debug_scramble(ptr, n_bytes) /*nothing*/
    2963             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    2964             : 
    2965             : 
    2966             : 
    2967             : /*
    2968             : Allocate a complete object of type utp and size n_bytes in the interpreter's
    2969             : storage stack, including prefix storage to keep bookkeeping information.
    2970             : Initialize the prefix and mark the object as being complete (see
    2971             : mark_complete_class_object_if_needed above).  n_bytes must be positive.
    2972             : storage_ptr is set to the data portion of the allocated storage (i.e., the
    2973             : first byte after the prefix).
    2974             : */
    2975             : #define alloc_complete_object(ips, n_bytes, utp, storage_ptr)                \
    2976             : {                                                                            \
    2977             :   a_byte_count  total_size, prefix_size;                                     \
    2978             :   a_byte        *ptr, *data_ptr;                                             \
    2979             :   compute_prefix_size_for_type(utp, n_bytes, prefix_size);                   \
    2980             :   total_size = prefix_size+n_bytes;                                          \
    2981             :   alloc_stack_bytes(ips, total_size, ptr);                                   \
    2982             :   memzero((char*)ptr, size_t_arg(prefix_size-sizeof(a_type_ptr)));           \

    2991             : Allocate a complete object of type utp in the interpreter's static storage

    2993             : */

    3221           0 : static a_boolean addresses_are_comparable(an_interpreter_state  *ips,
    3222             :                                           a_constexpr_address   *cap1,
    3223             :                                           a_constexpr_address   *cap2)
    3224             : /*
    3225             : Return TRUE if the given addresses can be compared using relational operators.
    3226             : The caller is responsible for ensuring that these are addresses pointing to
    3227             : interpreter storage.
    3228             : */
    3229             : {
    3230           0 :   a_boolean  comparable;
    3231             : 
    3232           0 :   if (cap1->complete_object != cap2->complete_object) {
    3233             :     /* Addresses into distinct objects are never comparable. */
    3234             :     comparable = FALSE;
    3235           0 :   } else if (cap1->address == cap2->address) {
    3236             :     /* Equal addresses are always comparable. */
    3237             :     comparable = TRUE;
    3238           0 :   } else if (cap1->address == NULL || cap2->address == NULL) {
    3239             :     /* A null pointer cannot be compared to a non-null pointer. */
    3240             :     comparable = FALSE;
    3241             :   } else {
    3242           0 :     a_byte*     parent_addr = cap1->complete_object;
    3243           0 :     a_type_ptr  parent_type = complete_object_type(parent_addr);
    3244           0 :     for (;;) {
    3245           0 :       if (parent_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_array) {
    3246           0 :         a_type_ptr    etp = skip_typerefs(
    3247             :                                      parent_type->variant.array.element_type);
    3248           0 :         a_byte_count  esize, idx1, idx2;

    3250           0 :         esize = value_bytes_for_type(ips, etp, &dummy_result);
    3251           0 :         idx1 = ((a_byte_count)(cap1->address-parent_addr))/esize;
    3252           0 :         idx2 = ((a_byte_count)(cap2->address-parent_addr))/esize;
    3253           0 :         if (idx1 != idx2) {
    3254             :           /* Pointers to or into different elements of the same array are
    3255             :              comparable. */
    3256           0 :           comparable = TRUE;
    3257           0 :           break;
    3258             :         } else {
    3259             :           /* Continue the check with the common element. */
    3260           0 :           parent_type = etp;
    3261           0 :           parent_addr += idx1*esize;
    3262             :         }  /* if */
    3263           0 :       } else if (is_immediate_class_type(parent_type)) {
    3264           0 :         a_field_ptr  fp1, fp2;
    3265           0 :         a_base_class_ptr  bcp1, bcp2;
    3266           0 :         a_byte_count      offset;
    3267           0 :         find_subobject_for_interpreter_address(ips, cap1, parent_addr,
    3268             :                                                parent_type, &fp1, &bcp1);
    3269           0 :         find_subobject_for_interpreter_address(ips, cap2, parent_addr,
    3270             :                                                parent_type, &fp2, &bcp2);
    3271           0 :         if (bcp1 != bcp2) {
    3272             :           /* At least one address is in a base class subobject, and the other
    3273             :              is not in that same subobject.  The addresses are not
    3274             :              comparable. */
    3275             :           comparable = FALSE;
    3276           0 :           break;
    3277           0 :         } else if (bcp1 != NULL) {
    3278             :           /* Both addresses point to or into the same base class subobject:
    3279             :              Continue the check within that. */
    3280           0 :           parent_type = bcp1->type;
    3281           0 :           get_mapped_byte_count(&persistent_map, bcp1, offset);
    3282           0 :           parent_addr += offset;
    3283           0 :         } else if (fp1 != fp2) {
    3284             :           /* Addresses to or into different fields can be compared if and only
    3285             :              if the fields have the same accessibility and are not members of a
    3286             :              union. */
    3287           0 :           comparable =
    3288           0 :                    fp1->source_corresp.access == fp2->source_corresp.access &&

    3291             :         } else {
    3292             :           /* Both addresses point to or into the same field subobject: Continue
    3293             :              the check within that. */

    3295           0 :           get_mapped_byte_count(&persistent_map, fp1, offset);
    3296           0 :           parent_addr += offset;
    3297             :         }  /* if */
    3298             :       }  else {
    3299             :         /* This can happen when comparing a pointer to a scalar object, and
    3300             :            one "past the end" of that object. */
    3301             :         comparable = TRUE;
    3302             :         break;
    3303             :       }  /* if */
    3304             :     }  /* for */
    3305             :   }  /* if */
    3306           0 :   return comparable;
    3307             : }  /* addresses_are_comparable */

    3440             :                                  /*neg_infinity=*/(a_boolean*)NULL,
    3441             :                                  /*not_a_number=*/(a_boolean*)NULL));

    3485           0 :       break;

    3577           0 : void db_call_stack(void  *ips)

    3608             : #if EXPENSIVE_CHECKING
    3609             : 
    3610             : static void check_no_variant_path_cycle(a_variant_path_entry_ptr  path)
    3611             : /*
    3612             : Trigger an internal error if the given path contains a cycle.
    3613             : */
    3614             : {
    3615             :   if (path != NULL) {
    3616             :     a_variant_path_entry_ptr  ahead = path->next;
    3617             :     a_variant_path_entry_ptr  it = path;
    3618             :     for (;;) {
    3619             :       if (ahead == NULL) break;
    3620             :       if (it != ahead) {
    3621             :         ahead = ahead->next;
    3622             :         if (ahead == NULL) break;
    3623             :         if (it != ahead) {
    3624             :           ahead = ahead->next;
    3625             :           it = it->next;
    3626             :           continue;
    3627             :         }  /* if */
    3628             :       }  /* if */
    3629             :       /* The "ahead" pointer has caught up with the "path" pointer.  There is
    3630             :          therefore a cycle. */
    3631             :       unexpected_condition_str("variant path loop");
    3632             :     }  /* for */
    3633             :   }  /* if */
    3634             : }  /* check_no_variant_path_cycle */
    3635             : 
    3636             : #endif /* EXPENSIVE_CHECKING */
    3637             : 
    3638             : static void make_anon_union_path(a_symbol_ptr              au_sym,
    3639             :                                  a_variant_path_entry_ptr  *p_last_entry,
    3640             :                                  a_byte                    **p_addr)
    3641             : /*
    3642             : au_sym represents an anonymous union parent field being selected in an object
    3643             : at address *p_addr.  Update *p_addr to point to the address of the anonymous
    3644             : union parent object.  au_sym may itself be a member of anonymous enclosing
    3645             : anonymous unions; if so, append to *p_last_entry a variant path corresponding
    3646             : to those anonymous union objects.
    3647             : */
    3648             : {
    3649             :   a_variant_path_entry_ptr  vpep, last_entry;
    3650             :   a_field_ptr               aufp = au_sym->variant.field.ptr;
    3651             :   a_symbol_ptr              au_parent;
    3652             :   a_byte_count              offset;
    3653             : 
    3654             :   au_parent = au_sym->variant.field.anonymous_parent_object;
    3655             :   if (au_parent != NULL && symbol_is(au_parent, sk_field)) {
    3656             :     a_type_ptr  au_type = au_parent->variant.field.ptr->type;
    3657             :     if (au_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_union &&
    3658             :         !au_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_nonstd_anonymous_union_type) {
    3659             :       /* aufp is not the top-most anonymous union.  Recurse to determine its
    3660             :          parent's address, then append a variant entry to select it. */
    3661             :       make_anon_union_path(au_parent, p_last_entry, p_addr);
    3662             :     }  /* if */
    3663             :   }  /* if */
    3664             :   last_entry = *p_last_entry;
    3665             :   vpep = alloc_variant_path_entry();
    3666             :   vpep->next = NULL;
    3667             :   last_entry->next = vpep;
    3668             :   if (parent_class_of(aufp)->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_union) {
    3669             :     /* aufp is a member of a union itself (always the case in recursive calls,
    3670             :        but also if the original call is for a member of an ordinary union). */
    3671             :     last_entry->field = aufp;
    3672             :     last_entry->base_address = *p_addr;
    3673             :   }  /* if */
    3674             :   *p_last_entry = vpep;
    3675             :   get_mapped_byte_count(&persistent_map, aufp, offset);
    3676             :   *p_addr += offset;
    3677             : }  /* make_anon_union_path */
    3678             : 
    3679             : 
    3680             : static void add_to_variant_path(a_constexpr_address  *addr,
    3681             :                                 a_field_ptr          union_field,
    3682             :                                 a_type_ptr           top_type)
    3683             : /*
    3684             : The given field of a union object or subobject pointed to by addr is being
    3685             : selected.  Add that field to the variant path associated with addr (and, if
    3686             : this is the first field added to the path, also add a prefix field for array
    3687             : element selections).  If union_field is a standard anonymous union field,
    3688             : addr->address is adjusted to the innermost anonymous union parent and
    3689             : additional variant path entries are added for nested anonymous unions if
    3690             : needed.  top_type is the top-most class type in the selection: It may not
    3691             : be a union type if union_field is an anonymous union field.
    3692             : */
    3693             : {
    3694             :   a_variant_path_entry_ptr  last_entry, vpep;
    3695             :   a_symbol_ptr              au_parent;
    3696             : 
    3697             :   if (addr->flags & CA_VARIANT_PATH) {
    3698             :     /* This entry already has a variant path: Find its end. */
    3699             :     last_entry = addr->variant.variant_path->next;
    3700             :     while (last_entry->next != NULL) {
    3701             :       last_entry = last_entry->next;
    3702             :     }  /* while */
    3703             :   } else {
    3704             :     /* No entries yet: Create a first entry to record an array base address if
    3705             :        needed. */
    3706             :     addr->variant.variant_path = alloc_variant_path_entry();
    3707             :     last_entry = addr->variant.variant_path;
    3708             :     last_entry->next = NULL;
    3709             :     last_entry->field = NULL;
    3710             :     last_entry->base_address = NULL;
    3711             :     addr->flags |= CA_VARIANT_PATH;
    3712             :   }  /* if */
    3713             :   if (top_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_union) {
    3714             :     /* An ordinary union member.  Just add a new entry. */
    3715             :     vpep = alloc_variant_path_entry();
    3716             :     vpep->next = NULL;
    3717             :     last_entry->next = vpep;
    3718             :     last_entry = vpep;
    3719             :   }  /* if */
    3720             :   au_parent = symbol_for(union_field)->variant.field.anonymous_parent_object;
    3721             :   if (au_parent != NULL && symbol_is(au_parent, sk_field)) {
    3722             :     a_type_ptr  au_type = au_parent->variant.field.ptr->type;
    3723             :     if (au_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_union &&
    3724             :         !au_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_nonstd_anonymous_union_type) {
    3725             :       make_anon_union_path(au_parent, &last_entry, &addr->address);
    3726             :     }  /* if */
    3727             :   }  /* if */
    3728             :   last_entry->field = union_field;
    3729             :   last_entry->base_address = addr->address;

    3731             :   check_no_variant_path_cycle(addr->variant.variant_path);
    3732             : #endif /* EXPENSIVE_CHECKING */

    3734             : 
    3735             : 
    3736           0 : static void copy_variant_path(a_constexpr_address  *addr)
    3737             : /*
    3738             : Replace the variant path pointed to by addr by a copy of that same path.
    3739             : (This is used to avoid sharing paths in cases where one will be cleaned up
    3740             : soon but the other must persist.  E.g., this happens after copying a variable
    3741             : (whose variant path must persist) to temporary expression storage.
    3742             : */
    3743             : {
    3744           0 :   a_variant_path_entry_ptr  vpep, *p_vpep;
    3745             : 
    3746             : #if EXPENSIVE_CHECKING
    3747             :   check_no_variant_path_cycle(addr->variant.variant_path);
    3748             : #endif /* EXPENSIVE_CHECKING */
    3749           0 :   p_vpep = &addr->variant.variant_path;
    3750           0 :   vpep = *p_vpep;
    3751           0 :   do {
    3752           0 :     a_variant_path_entry_ptr  new_entry = alloc_variant_path_entry();
    3753           0 :     *p_vpep = new_entry;
    3754           0 :     new_entry->field = vpep->field;
    3755           0 :     new_entry->base_address = vpep->base_address;
    3756           0 :     p_vpep = &new_entry->next;
    3757           0 :     vpep = vpep->next;
    3758           0 :   } while (vpep != NULL);
    3759           0 :   *p_vpep = NULL;
    3760           0 : }  /* copy_variant_path */
    3761             : 
    3762             : 
    3763           0 : static void release_variant_path(a_constexpr_address  *addr)
    3764             : /*
    3765             : Release the variant path entries associated with the given address.  The caller
    3766             : is responsible for ensuring that there are such entries.
    3767             : */
    3768             : {
    3769           0 :   a_variant_path_entry_ptr  entries, vpep;
    3770           0 :   unsigned long             n_freed = 2;
    3771             : 
    3772           0 :   entries = addr->variant.variant_path;
    3773             :   /* There are always at least two entries on a variant path (the first of
    3774             :      which is a placeholder entry to potentially hold the base address of an
    3775             :      array). */
    3776           0 :   vpep = entries->next;
    3777           0 :   while (vpep->next != NULL) {
    3778           0 :     vpep = vpep->next;
    3779           0 :     n_freed += 1;
    3780             :   }  /* while */
    3781           0 :   vpep->next = free_variant_path_entries;
    3782           0 :   free_variant_path_entries = entries;
    3783           0 :   n_free_variant_path_entries += n_freed;
    3784           0 :   addr->flags &= ~CA_VARIANT_PATH;
    3785           0 :   addr->variant.base_address = entries->base_address;
    3786           0 : }  /* release_variant_path */
